reviews.text:
The worst servers and food.
The female servers kept on ignoring any request. They either do not understand English or just do not want to work.
And I couldn't stand with the bad smell of the meat.

We have been told that the specialty of Seville is the pork im whiskey sauce.  For me it was something new to my taste buds. The problem is that the whiskey was too strong for me to handle I got red on the face and almost developed hives due to my allergy to alcohol.

The views from the second floor are something to talk about though!

We were there as part of our end of the year school trip. The food was delicious and the writers were really welcoming and nice. It was really hot outside and inside it was so fresh and comfy. As a group visit I strongly recommend it. The menu is filling so don't eat too many tapas before.

I was here at a congress dinner. The surroundings seemed nice enough but the food I got, vegetarian option, was horrible. First course a gazpacho, was ok. Main course you can see in the picture,except for the one little cherry tomato and 3cm x 1 cm piece of carrot that I ate. The dish was meant to be warm, but was cold, and whatever it was that was supposed to replace the meat was chewy and didn't feel like it was supposed to be eaten. The rest rooms were clean. The dinner started later than the given time. The service took time, when we had eaten the starter at our table, 5 minutes later they still carried out starters. They ran out of sparkling water.
The gem of Seville! Fantastic food. Fantastic service. Lovely ambiance. Couldn't ask for a better evening. A highlight of our entire trip to Spain.
